Stem: The Coriolis effect is a result of the rotation of Earth. It has a direct impact on the directions of Earth’s winds, as shown in the diagram below. Northern Hemisphere winds are deflected to the right, and Southern Hemisphere winds are deflected to the left. How does the Coriolis effect MOST ACCURATELY impact Earth’s climate?
Choices: A) It allows hurricanes to form at the equator from the cycling of wind in different directions., B) It keeps a constant flow of energy throughout the planet so that all parts of Earth have the same climate., C) It affects ocean currents, which transport warm surface water, evening out the distribution of heat on Earth’s surface., D) It makes the Northern Hemisphere windier than the Southern Hemisphere, and the ocean currents are stronger as well.
